content: northern star pattern by tally s crafts there is something magical about crochet stars as they are both stunning and extremely versatile thanks to that it is so simple to turn them not only into granny squares or hexagons but they are also an excellent base for making mandalas recommended yarn scheepjes cahlista hook size 4 5mm finished size approx 13cm abbreviations us terms single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet treble_crochet - treble_crochet fpsc front post single_crochet fphdc front post half_double_crochet fpdc front post double_crochet fptr front post treble chain - chain st s - stitch es skip- skip st - stitch slip_stitch - slip_stitch space space r round pop - popcorn special stitches popcorn - 5dc ch1 to close the pop picot - ch3 insert your hook in the first chain pull up a loop join with a slip_stitch round 1 start with a magic_ring ch2 counts as the first half_double_crochet make 11 more half_double_crochet join with a slip_stitch 12hdc round 2 start by making pop in any half_double_crochet from the previous round pop in each of the next half_double_crochet join with a slip_stitch 12 pop round 3 standing fphdc around any pop 2sc in the space between pop fphdc around the next pop repeat join with a slip_stitch 24sc 12fpsc round 4 standing fpsc around any fphdc from the previus round single_crochet in the next st fptr around the next half_double_crochet from r1 single_crochet in the second single_crochet don t skip any single_crochet fpsc around the next fphdc repeat join with a slip_stitch 12fpsc 12fptr 24sc round 5 standing fpsc around any fptr from the previous round single_crochet ch3 skip the next single_crochet single_crochet in the next st fpsc around the next fptr single_crochet in the next 3 single_crochet fpsc around the next treble_crochet repeat join with a slip_stitch 6ch3sp 30sc 12fpsc round 6 standing fphdc around any fpsc from r4 5dc ch3 5dc in the ch3sp fphdc around the next fpsc from r4 repeat join with a slip_stitch 6fphdc 6 petals 6ch3sp round 7 standing fpsc around any fphdc from the previous round bphdc around the next 5dc 2sc picot 2sc bphdc around the next 5dc fpsc around the next fphdc repeat join with a slip_stitch 50bphdc 6 picots 24sc it is a free pattern designed by tally s crafts you may use the photos as long as you credit me and link to my website http //www tallyscrafts com/ or instagram @tallyscrafts you are not allowed to post the pattern and the photos as your own
